data.title: Patrick Kremer - CEO, Mtivity at Mtivity
data.meta_description: Patrick Kremer has a diverse work experience spanning multiple industries and roles.
data.text:
Patrick Kremer has a diverse work experience spanning multiple industries and roles. Patrick started their career at IBM Global Services in 1985 in the Market and Strategy Group. Patrick then joined Sybase as a Group Manager in Channels Development from 1993 to 1996. Following this, they worked at Borland/Visigenic Software as Director of Channels Marketing, where they played a key role in the company's successful IPO.

In 1998, Kremer joined Adobe as Director of Business Development, focusing on Macromedia. Patrick also served on the Board of Directors of the Family Services Agency of San Francisco during this time. Kremer later became Vice President of Business Development at Adobe's TrueSpectra division from 2001 to 2002.

In 2003, they transitioned to venture capital and joined DN Capital as a Venture Partner, contributing their expertise to early-stage investments. In 2005, Kremer became CEO of Mtivity, a position they currently hold. Patrick initially joined Mtivity as Chairman of the Board of Directors in 2002 and led the company through multiple rounds of institutional investment totaling $20 million. In 2012, Kremer led the successful Management Buyout (MBO) of Mtivity.

Kremer also briefly worked at IOCOM as a Director from 2011 to 2013. Overall, their experience demonstrates a strong track record in leadership, business development, venture capital, and strategic management.

Patrick Kremer attended Crespi Carmelite High School for their secondary education. After completing high school, they pursued a Bachelor of Arts (BA) degree in Economics at the University of California, Davis. Additionally, they earned an MBA degree at the London Business School, specializing in Sloan Fellow Technology Finance.
